issue.title: Add reset button to React counter
issue.body: There is a simple React counter app in `repo/`. In `src/App.jsx`, add a new "Reset" button that sets the counter back to 0. Update the README to mention the reset behavior.

analysis.dockerfile_suggested:
FROM node:18-alpine

WORKDIR /app

COPY package*.json ./

RUN npm install

COPY . .

RUN npm run build

EXPOSE 3000

CMD ["npm", "run", "preview"]

steps.description: Inspect `src/App.jsx` to understand the existing counter implementation.
steps.rationale: Need to understand the current state of the counter to properly add the reset functionality. This will involve reading the React component's state and update logic.

steps.description: Modify `src/App.jsx` to add a "Reset" button and its associated handler function to set the counter state to 0.
steps.rationale: This step implements the core functionality requested in the issue.  A new button element will be added to the JSX, and a corresponding function will be defined to update the counter's state when the button is clicked.

steps.description: Test the "Reset" button functionality manually by running the app using `npm run dev` and verifying that the counter resets to 0 when the button is clicked.
steps.rationale: Manual testing is crucial to ensure the new functionality works as expected in a live environment.  This verifies the button click triggers the state update correctly.

steps.description: Update the README file to include a description of the new "Reset" button and its behavior.
steps.rationale: The issue description requires updating the README to reflect the new functionality. This ensures users are aware of the reset feature.

finalize.commit_message: Add reset button to React counter and update README
